definition: A person who trains and works with an animal, especially a dog.
exampleSentence: The handler gave a command, and the dog began searching the building.

definition: A substance or device that can cause an explosion.
exampleSentence: The bomb squad found an explosive hidden inside the package.

definition: To discover or notice something that is not easy to see, hear, or smell.
exampleSentence: The dog was able to detect the scent of the hidden object.

definition: A signal or warning that something has been found or that danger is near.
exampleSentence: The dog gave an alert by sitting down next to the suspicious bag.

definition: A dog, or relating to dogs.
exampleSentence: The police canine sniffed every car in the parking lot.

definition: A unit used to measure how loud a sound is.
exampleSentence: A normal conversation is about 60 decibels.

definition: The state of being exposed to something, especially something harmful.
exampleSentence: Long exposure to loud music can hurt your ears.

definition: Lasting forever; not temporary.
exampleSentence: The damage to his hearing was permanent and could not be fixed.

definition: Harm or injury that makes something less useful or valuable.
exampleSentence: Loud sounds can cause damage to the tiny cells inside your ear.

definition: How often something happens, or the rate of sound vibrations that determines pitch.
exampleSentence: High-frequency sounds, like a whistle, have a higher pitch.

definition: A person or company that pays money to support an event, activity, or person, usually in exchange for advertising.
exampleSentence: The energy drink company was the main sponsor of the skateboarding competition.

definition: The power to change how someone thinks or acts.
exampleSentence: Social media stars have a lot of influence over what their followers buy.

definition: To convince someone to do or believe something.
exampleSentence: The ad was designed to persuade teenagers to try the new snack.

definition: A person who buys and uses goods or services.
exampleSentence: As a smart consumer, Maria always compared prices before buying.

definition: A name or symbol that identifies a company's products.
exampleSentence: She always wore the same brand of sneakers because she liked how they fit.

definition: Aware of and responding to one's surroundings; done on purpose.
exampleSentence: He made a conscious choice to change his life for the better.

definition: To give someone a reason or desire to do something.
exampleSentence: Love for his son motivated Gardner to work harder.

definition: A person who buys and sells stocks and other investments for other people.
exampleSentence: Gardner got a job as a stockbroker and worked hard to succeed.

definition: The qualities that make a person different from everyone else.
exampleSentence: Self-motivation is a mark of your individuality.

definition: Feeling that something is too much to handle.
exampleSentence: Do not take on so much that you get overwhelmed.

definition: An experienced person who gives advice and guidance to someone younger or less experienced.
exampleSentence: A good mentor can help a teen succeed in school and in life.

definition: All the people who were born around the same time period.
exampleSentence: You may need the wisdom of someone from an older generation.

definition: Providing encouragement or new ideas; making people feel motivated.
exampleSentence: Hollywood has long recognized our appreciation of inspirational teachers.

definition: A person who freely offers to do something without being paid.
exampleSentence: Over 3 million American adults volunteer as mentors to young people.

definition: Able to be relied on as honest and truthful.
exampleSentence: Kids value mentors who are trustworthy, caring, and understanding.

definition: The feeling that you must do the same things as other people your age in order to be liked or accepted.
exampleSentence: Peer pressure can push you in the wrong direction or down the wrong path.

definition: To persuade someone to do or believe something.
exampleSentence: Your peers may try to convince you to do things they are doing.

definition: Doubtful; possibly wrong or dishonest.
exampleSentence: Before you say yes to questionable behavior, take a minute to think about it.

definition: To face a difficult situation directly.
exampleSentence: An exit plan is a good way to confront a challenging situation.

definition: Possibly; with the chance of happening.
exampleSentence: Use your exit plan to get yourself out of a potentially bad situation.

definition: Something that is needed and cannot be done without.
exampleSentence: Some people say cell phones are a necessity, while others call them toys.

definition: To officially say that something is not allowed.
exampleSentence: Many schools have banned cell phone use in class.

definition: To share information or ideas with others.
exampleSentence: School leaders need to communicate cell phone rules better.
